Roper iPoll Question Toplines -- Downloaded: Apr 12, 2025 2:31:49 AM UTC

------------------------------------------------------------
Gallup Poll [06/4/2010 - 06/6/2010]

Do you approve or disapprove of the job Barack Obama is doing as president?

47%	Approve
44%	Disapprove
9%	No opinion

Citation: Gallup Organization. Gallup Organization Poll: June 2010, Question 1. USGALLUP.060710.R01. Gallup Organization. Cornell University, Ithaca, NY: Roper Center for Public Opinion Research, 2010. Web. Jun-04-2010.

Question: [USGALLUP.060710.R01]
Study: [Roper #31112188]

Sample: National adult
Sample Size: 1535
Data provided by The Roper Center for Public Opinion Research.

Gallup Poll (AIPO) [01/8/1942 - 01/14/1942]

What is your opinion of the way Roosevelt is handling his job as President today?

Subpopulation: Asked of Form T half sample

Notes: * = less than .5 percent

47%	Fine, best, very good, etc.
38%	Approve--All right, okay, good, approve
*	Approve--Fine, but has made a mistake in appointments
5%	Disapprove--Poor, not a good administration
1%	Disapprove--Very poor
*	Disapprove--Spending too much on non-defense
1%	Disapprove--Poor in organizing for production
1%	Disapprove--Do not approve of handling national affairs--financing, unemployment etc.
1%	Disapprove--Trying to do too much himself, get more help, less responsibility
*	Miscellaneous
*	Fifty-fifty
2%	Foreign policy okay, domestic not so good
3%	No answer

Citation: Gallup Organization. Gallup Poll # 1942-0258: Politics/Automobiles/Employment, Question 29. USGALLUP.42-258.QT10B. Gallup Organization. Cornell University, Ithaca, NY: Roper Center for Public Opinion Research, 1942. Web. Jan-08-1942.

Question: [USGALLUP.42-258.QT10B]
Study: [Roper #31087241]

Sample: National Adult
Sample Size: 2996
Data provided by The Roper Center for Public Opinion Research.

Gallup/CNN/USA Today Poll [01/12/1996 - 01/15/1996]

(Do you approve or disapprove of the way Bill Clinton is handling his job as president?) How strongly would you say (approve/ disapprove)--would you say very strongly, or not so strongly?

Notes: * = less than .5 percent.

26%	Approve very strongly
20%	Approve not so strongly
1%	Approve--don't know/refused strength
30%	Disapprove very strongly
16%	Disapprove not so strongly
*	Disapprove--don't know/refused strength
7%	Don't know/Refused

Citation: Cable News Network (CNN)/USA Today. Gallup/CNN/USA Today Poll:  1996 Election, Question 1. USGALLUP.01002.Q01A. Gallup Organization. Cornell University, Ithaca, NY: Roper Center for Public Opinion Research, 1996. Web. Jan-12-1996.

Question: [USGALLUP.01002.Q01A]
Study: [Roper #31088287]

Sample: National adult
Sample Size: 1039

37%	Approve--moderately

(Do you approve or disapprove of the way Bill Clinton is handling his job as president?) (If approve/disapprove, ask:) How strongly would you say you approve/disapprove--would you say very strongly, or not so strongly?

Notes: * = less than .5 percent

51%	Approve--very strongly
17%	Approve--not so strongly
1%	Approve--don't know/refused strength (vol.)
22%	Disapprove--very strongly
7%	Disapprove--not so strongly

Do you approve or disapprove of the way Donald Trump is handling his job as president?

43%	Approve
53%	Disapprove
4%	No opinion

Citation: Gallup. Gallup Poll, Question 1. 31122546.00000. Gallup. Cornell University, Ithaca, NY: Roper Center for Public Opinion Research, 2025. Web. Mar-03-2025.

Question: [31122546.00000]
Study: [Roper #31122546]

Sample: National adult
Sample Size: 1002
Data provided by The Roper Center for Public Opinion Research.

------------------------------------------------------------
Gallup Poll [03/2/2015 - 03/4/2015]

Do you approve or disapprove of the way Barack Obama is handling his job as president?

46%	Approve
49%	Disapprove
2%	Don't know
3%	Refused

Citation: Gallup Organization. Gallup News Service Poll: Presidential Candidate Favorable Ratings, Question 1. USGALLUP.2015TR0302.Q01. Gallup Organization. Cornell University, Ithaca, NY: Roper Center for Public Opinion Research, 2015. Web. Mar-02-2015.

Question: [USGALLUP.2015TR0302.Q01]
Study: [Roper #31089109]

Sample: National adult
Sample Size: 1522
Data provided by The Roper Center for Public Opinion Research.

16%	Somewhat approve
13%	Somewhat disapprove
41%	Strongly disapprove
4%	No opinion
